member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection
member.summary:
Interface for scaled voice connection management via SIP/RTP (Kamailio + RTPEngine).
Architecture Overview:
In scaled mode (6+ participants), audio flows through a central RTP server instead of peer-to-peer connections. The client:
Registers with Kamailio using SIP credentials from
Sends audio to RTPEngine, which mixes all participants
Receives mixed audio from RTPEngine
Key Differences from P2P ():
- Single server connection instead of N peer connections
- SIP REGISTER/INVITE instead of WebRTC SDP exchange
- Server handles audio mixing; client receives pre-mixed stream
- No ICE candidates; RTP server address is known
Default Implementation:
ScaledVoiceConnection uses SIPSorcery for both SIP signaling and RTP media transport.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.RoomId
member.summary: The voice room ID this connection is for.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.State
member.summary: Current connection state.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.IsAudioActive
member.summary: Gets whether audio is currently flowing (registered and RTP active).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.SipUsername
member.summary: SIP registration username. Returns empty string before credentials are set via .

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.ConnectAsync(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SipConnectionCredentials,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Connects to the voice conference using the provided credentials.
This method performs:
SIP REGISTER with Kamailio using the provided credentials
SIP INVITE to join the conference room
RTP session establishment for audio
member.returns: True if connection succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.DisconnectAsync
member.summary:
Gracefully disconnects from the voice conference.
Sends SIP BYE to leave the conference and de-registers from Kamailio.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.RefreshRegistrationAsync(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SipConnectionCredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Refreshes the SIP registration before credentials expire.
Call this before to maintain the connection without interruption.
member.param: New credentials if password changed, or null to re-use existing.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnStateChanged
member.summary: Fired when the connection state changes.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnError
member.summary: Fired when an error occurs during connection or streaming. Parameters: (errorCode, errorMessage)

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnConnected
member.summary: Fired when a connection attempt succeeds.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnDisconnected
member.summary: Fired when the connection is lost (server disconnect, network failure, etc.). Parameters: (reason)

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnRegistrationExpiring
member.summary:
Fired when SIP registration is about to expire.
Subscribe to this event to call with new credentials. Parameter is seconds until expiration.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.SendAudioFrame(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends an audio frame to the RTP server.
The server mixes this with other participants and distributes the mixed audio. Use the same format as for consistency.
member.param: PCM audio samples as normalized floats (-1.0 to 1.0).
Sample rate in Hz (typically 48000 for Opus).
Number of audio channels (1 for mono, 2 for stereo).

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IScaledVoiceConnection.OnAudioFrameReceived
member.summary:
Fired when a mixed audio frame is received from the RTP server.
Unlike P2P mode, this is a SINGLE mixed stream containing all other participants. The server has already combined everyone's audio.
member.remarks: Parameters: (float[] samples, int sampleRate, int channels)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IVideoPeerConnection
member.summary:
Interface for single-peer WebRTC video connection.
Important Limitations:
- Video is intentionally NOT supported in multi-peer scenarios
- P2P video bandwidth scales quadratically with participants (N*(N-1)/2 connections)
- For 3+ participants, use server-side media mixing (Kamailio+RTPEngine)
- This interface is for 1:1 video calls only
Stride Integration:
Video frames are provided as raw RGBA byte arrays. Use Stride's Texture API to display received video and camera capture for sending.
member.remarks: The default SIPSorcery implementation is a stub that throws . Full video support will be added when needed for 1:1 video scenarios.

member.summary: Sends a video frame to the remote peer.
member.param: Raw RGBA pixel data (width * height * 4 bytes).

member.summary: Fired when a video frame is received from the remote peer.
member.remarks: Parameters: (byte[] rgbaPixels, int width, int height, long timestampMs)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.IVoicePeerConnection
member.summary:
Interface for WebRTC peer connection management for P2P voice chat.
The default implementation uses SIPSorcery (v8.0.14, BSD-3-Clause license). This interface allows alternative implementations for engines with native WebRTC support (e.g., Unity WebRTC package).
Game Engine Integration (Stride, Unity):
- Subscribe to to play received audio
- Call with microphone capture data
- The SDK handles all WebRTC negotiation (SDP/ICE) automatically

member.summary: Creates an SDP offer for initiating a connection. Call this when you're the initiator (connecting to an existing peer).
member.returns: SDP offer string to send to the remote peer.

member.summary: Sets the remote peer's SDP description (offer or answer).
member.param: The SDP string from the remote peer.
True if this is an offer (you need to create an answer), false if it's an answer.

member.summary: Creates an SDP answer in response to an offer. Call with the offer first.
member.returns: SDP answer string to send to the remote peer.

member.summary:
Sends an audio frame to the remote peer.

Capture microphone audio using Stride's Microphone class, convert to float[] PCM samples, and call this method.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.Services.RtpStreamHelper
member.summary:
Helper class for managing RTP audio streaming to/from an RTP server (like RTPEngine).
Purpose:
Handles RTP packet send/receive for scaled voice tier, including:
Audio encoding (PCM → Opus/G.711/G.722)
Audio decoding (Opus/G.711/G.722 → PCM)
SSRC de-duplication for mixed streams
Jitter buffer management (via SIPSorcery)
Statistics collection
SSRC De-duplication:
In scaled mode, the RTP server sends a single mixed stream. However, if participants join/leave, the SSRC may change. This helper tracks SSRC changes and handles the transition gracefully without audio glitches.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.Services.RtpStreamHelper.MaxTrackedSsrcs
member.summary: Maximum number of SSRC sources to track for de-duplication.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.Services.RtpStreamHelper.SsrcTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: SSRC timeout in seconds - stop tracking an SSRC after this duration of inactivity.

member.summary: Whether the RTP stream is currently active.

member.summary: Whether audio sending is muted.

member.summary: The currently active SSRC for receiving audio.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.Services.RtpStreamHelper.TrackedSsrcCount
member.summary: Number of unique SSRCs seen during this session.

member.summary: Local RTP port being used.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVideoPeer
member.summary:
WebRTC video peer connection stub using SIPSorcery.
IMPORTANT: This is a stub implementation. Video support is NOT YET IMPLEMENTED. All video methods throw .
Limitations:
- Video is for 1:1 peer connections ONLY
- P2P video does NOT scale to multiple participants (bandwidth = N*(N-1)/2)
- For 3+ participants, use server-side media mixing (not P2P)
- This class is NOT used by
Future Implementation Notes:
When implementing video support, consider:
- VP8/VP9/H.264 codec selection based on peer capabilities
- Resolution/framerate negotiation via SDP
- Bandwidth estimation and adaptive bitrate
- Frame rate limiting based on network conditions
member.remarks:
SIPSorcery v8.0.14 supports video via the RTCPeerConnection class. Video tracks can be added similarly to audio tracks, but require:
Video encoder (VP8/H.264) - see SIPSorceryMedia.FFmpeg or platform-specific encoders
Video decoder for received frames
Frame format conversion (RGBA to/from encoder format)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVideoPeer.#ctor(System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Creates a new SIPSorcery-based video peer connection stub.
Note: Video functionality is not yet implemented. Use this class only if you plan to implement video support yourself or are waiting for a future SDK update.
member.param: The remote peer's display name (for UI).
Optional STUN server URIs for NAT traversal.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVideoPeer.SendVideoFrame(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.exception: Always thrown - video not yet implemented.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVideoPeer.VideoCodec
member.remarks: Returns "none" since video is not implemented. When implemented, this would return the negotiated codec (e.g., "VP8", "H264").

member.summary:
Raises the event.
This method is internal for potential future extensions.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVoicePeer
member.summary:
WebRTC peer connection implementation using SIPSorcery.
License: SIPSorcery v8.0.14 is BSD-3-Clause (pre-May 2025 license change).
This version is pinned to maintain permissive licensing for all users.
Stride/Unity Integration:
- Subscribe to to play received audio
- Call with microphone PCM data
- The implementation handles Opus encoding/decoding automatically

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.SIPSorceryVoicePeer.#ctor(System.Guid,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a new SIPSorcery-based voice peer connection.
member.param: The remote peer's display name (for UI).
Optional STUN server URIs for NAT traversal. Defaults to Google's public STUN server.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager
P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.CurrentRoomId
member.summary: Gets the current voice room ID, or null if not in a room.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.IsInRoom
member.summary: Gets whether the client is currently in a voice room.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.CurrentTier
member.summary: Gets the current voice tier (P2P or Scaled).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.Peers
member.summary: Gets all active peer connections by peer session ID.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.ScaledConnection
member.summary: Gets the scaled voice connection when in scaled mode. Null when in P2P mode.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.IsScaledConnectionActive
member.summary: Gets whether the scaled connection is active and audio is flowing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.IsMuted
member.summary: Gets or sets whether local audio is muted (not sent to peers or server).

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnAudioReceived
member.summary: Fired when audio is received from any peer. Parameters: (peerSessionId, samples[], sampleRate, channels)

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnPeerJoined
member.summary: Fired when a new peer joins the room.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnPeerLeft
member.summary: Fired when a peer leaves the room.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnRoomClosed
member.summary: Fired when the room is closed (session ended, error, etc.).

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnTierUpgraded
member.summary:
Fired when the voice tier upgrades from P2P to Scaled.
When automatic tier transition is enabled (default), the manager will handle the transition automatically. This event is informational.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnScaledConnectionStateChanged
member.summary: Fired when the scaled connection state changes.

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnScaledConnectionError
member.summary: Fired when a scaled connection error occurs. Parameters: (errorCode, errorMessage)

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnPeerStateChanged
member.summary: Fired when a peer connection changes state. Parameters: (peerSessionId, newState)

member.name: E:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.OnIceCandidateReady
member.summary:
Fired when an ICE candidate needs to be sent to the server.
The SDK cannot send this automatically because the voice service is internal-only. You must call the game session service's UpdatePeerEndpoint API to relay this.
Parameters: (peerSessionId, iceCandidate)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.BannouClient)
member.summary: Creates a new VoiceRoomManager using the default SIPSorcery implementation.
member.param: The connected BannouClient for receiving voice events.

member.summary:
Creates a new VoiceRoomManager with custom connection factories.
Use this overload if you want to provide your own WebRTC or scaled tier implementation (e.g., Unity WebRTC package instead of SIPSorcery).
member.param: The connected BannouClient for receiving voice events.
Factory function to create P2P peer connections. Parameters: (peerSessionId, displayName, stunServers). If null, uses .
Factory function to create scaled connections. Parameters: (roomId). If null, uses .

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.SendAudioToAllPeers(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sends an audio frame to all connected peers (P2P mode) or the RTP server (scaled mode).
This method works transparently in both P2P and scaled tier modes.
Stride Integration:
Call this from your game loop with microphone capture data. Stride's Microphone class provides audio samples.
member.param: PCM audio samples as normalized floats (-1.0 to 1.0).
Sample rate in Hz (typically 48000 for Opus).
Number of audio channels (1 for mono, 2 for stereo).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.ProcessSdpAnswerAsync(System.Guid,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Manually processes an SDP answer received from a peer.
Call this when you receive an SDP answer via signaling (e.g., game session callback).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.AddIceCandidateForPeer(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary:
Manually adds an ICE candidate received from a peer.
Call this when you receive ICE candidates via signaling.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.Client.Voice.VoiceRoomManager.LeaveRoomAsync
member.summary: Leaves the current voice room and closes all connections (P2P and scaled).
